infoSections.text: **Unity 3D** is widely used for developing interactive applications, including games, simulations, and virtual environments. Its versatility extends to fields like education, healthcare, and neurotechnology, where it enables real-time data visualization, VR/AR experiences, and user-friendly interfaces. With its cross-platform capabilities and powerful development tools, Unity remains a leading choice for creating immersive and interactive applications.
